Question 2.Explanation: Accounting information seeks to provide records for all transaction. Question 12.Question:
Use the information below to answer this question.

A machine bought for ₦ 35,000 was estimated to have a life span of 5 years with scrap value of ₦ 9,000.

The yearly depreciation using the straight line method would be
Question 12.Explanation:
Depreciation = (Cost – Scrap Value)/Useful life

= ₦ (35,000 – 9,000)/5

= ₦ 5,200

Question 17.Question:
Given:

.₦₦
Opening capital1,500.
Capital introduced .500
Profit for the year .800
Cash drawings 250.

Calculate the closing capital
Question 17.Explanation:
Closing capital – (Opening Capital + Capital introduced – Drawings) = Profitx

Closing capital – ₦ (1,500 + 500 – 250) = ₦800

Closing capital – ₦1,750 = ₦800

Closing capital = ₦(1,750 + 800)

= ₦2,550

Simple average
Weighted average

Question 20.Question:
Use the information below to answer this question.

.1/1/201031/12/2010
.₦₦
Creditors 9,0009,800
Rent owing 3,8002,500
Rates prepaid 2,0003,500
Motor van 8,0008,000
Premises 10,50010,500

Find the opening capital
Question 20.Explanation:
Opening capital = Opening Asset - Opening liabilities

Assets = ₦(2,000 + 800 + 10,500)

= ₦20,500

Liabilities = (900 + 3,800)

= ₦12,800

Opening capital = ₦(20,500 — 12,800) =

₦7,700

Options.Value: ₦8,700
₦9,500
₦9,700
₦10,700

Question 21.Question:
Use the information below to answer this question.

.1/1/201031/12/2010
.₦₦
Creditors 9,0009,800
Rent owing 3,8002,500
Rates prepaid 2,0003,500
Motor van 8,0008,000
Premises 10,50010,500

Calculate the value of closing capital
Question 21.Explanation:
Closing capital= Assets — Liabilities

Assets = ₦(3,500 + 8,000 + 10,050) = ₦22,000

Liabilities = ₦(9,800 + 2,500)

= ₦12,300

Closing capital = ₦(22,000 - 12,300)

= ₦9,700

Options.Value: ₦2,000
₦14,000
₦20,000
₦30,000

Question 22.Question:
Given:

.₦
Opening capital 50,000
Closing capital 64,000
Drawings 16,000

Determine the net profit
Question 22.Explanation:
Net profit = Changes in capital = (Closing capital + Drawings) – Opening capital

= ₦(64,000 + 16,000) – ₦ 50,000

= ₦(80,000 – 50,000)

= ₦30,000

Note that a drawing is not an expense.

Options.Value: Closing capital less opening capital add drawings
Opening capital less closing capital add drawings
Opening capital less drawings add closing capital
Opening capital add closing capita add drawings

Question 23.Explanation: Net profit = Closing capital + Drawing - Opening capital - Additional capital

Question 24.Question:
Given:

The adjusted capital as at 31/1/2007 is

.₦
Drawings 35,000
Net loss25,000
Capital 1/1/200735,000
Additional capital10,000
Question 24.Explanation:
Net profit or loss = Adjusted capital + Drawing - Opening capital - Additional capital

₦25,000 = Adjusted capital + ₦35,000 – ₦35,000 – ₦10,000

₦25,000 = Adjusted capital - ₦10,000

Adjusted capital = ₦(25,000 +10,000)

= ₦35,000
